availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A coeducational institution located in Eminence, Henry County, Kentucky. Opened in September 1857 under S. G. Mullen and followed in 1858 by the Rev. William S. Giltner, who remained at the helm until 1893.

bibl.p: Benjamin B. Tyler, History of the Disciples of Christ (Louisville, Ky.: Christian Literature Co., 1895), 148-149; “Eminence College,” The Kentucky Encyclopedia, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 293; Alvin F. Lewis, "History of Higher Education in Kentucky," United States Bureau of Education, Circular of Information No. 3, 1899 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1899), 325-327.
